greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of representations of n as a sum of products of distinct pairs of integers larger than 1, considered to be equivalent when terms or factors are reordered.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms 0..1000 from Alois P. Heinz)
formula: G.f.: Product_{i>=1} Product_{j=2..i} (1 + x^(i*j)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 23 2019
example: a(1) = a(2) = a(3) = 0: no product is < 4.
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; local c;
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = Module[{c}, c = Ceiling[DivisorSigma[0, i]/2]-1; If[n==0, 1, If[i<2, 0, b[n, i-1]+Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1]*Binomial[c, j], {j, 1, Min[c, n/i]}]]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 70}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 19 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 22 2012
